wikitext.*:
'''''adan''''' is a [[Sindarin]] for a "[[Men|Man]]" (i.e., as opposed to [[Elves|Elf]], [[Dwarves|Dwarf]], [[Hobbits|Hobbit]], etc.). The plural is ''[[Edain]]''. Properly, this word refers only to those Men who are descended from the [[Three Houses of the Edain|Three Houses]] of Elf-friends.

==Examples==

*''Adanath'' = Fathers of Men
*''[[Adanel]]'' = "Man-star"
*[[Túrin|''Adanedhel'']] = "Man-elf"
*''[[Dúnedain|Dúnadan]] ='' "Man of the West"
*''[[Drúedain|Drúadan]]'' = "Wild man"
*''[[Elladan]] = "''Elf-man"
*''[[Easterlings|Rhúnadan]]'' = "Man of the East"

==Cognate==

*[[Quenya]] ''[[atar]]''
